Portal didn't need a sequel, but Portal 2 does an amazing job at expanding the world of Aperture. The stages are bigger and more elaborate, making you think (with portals) even harder than before. The newer game play elements that were added make the possibilities endless. The new characters add new personality to the game, yet don't seem out of place. The game game and co-op section are both highly entertaining, and the community map are a great place to find new content. I play the main game over and over again. It is a favorite of mine.

Iconic, and for good reason. Usually when a game tops the "Top Rated Steam Games" List, there's a good reason. The game is incredible. Everything is solid. The story is unique and well structured and plays beautifully from both a writing perspective as well as a gameplay perspective. The characters are well developed and engaging, and the plot flows smoothly. The puzzles remain true to the Portal feel, but are expanded upon organically in this sequel, which is up and away better than the original Portal.

This is a puzzle game that could appeal to an audience who doesn't seek puzzles, raising it above many other games as it awakens the puzzle solving in you. Although it isn't the best puzzle game I have played in terms of puzzles, it stands up there with those, and with a much better story and comfortable gameplay. 

The puzzles in Portal have a way of letting you know exactly what you're trying to do, and challenging you along the way. And as any good puzzle game, once you have discovered the solution, it is easy to perform. No small ledges to land on or terrible timing windows. Although it doesn't require you to think outside the box often, that's okay, that isn't what the game is about. It's about a wild ride, and Valve delivers.

Also, with the price-point on sales, there really is no reason to not play this game.

So many levels ... just goes on and on.  A beautifully dystopian small world in a vast cavern with miles of post-industrial, apocalyptic hellscape to explore.  Ingenious devices, plenty of surprises, always some new wrinkle and a bit of humor thrown in to keep you laughing even though you can never truly escape the endless dungeon.  Great puzzler for those so inclined.
A fantastic game. Got it years and years ago for the Xbox 360, and it was good enough to warrant buying it again for pc.

100% worth playing!

I got Portal 2 after falling in love with the original, and I must say, the developers did an excellent job at topping it off! Portal 2 is a huge improvement from Portal 1. There are more levels, more environments to explore, and more jokes! The story is absolutely amazing, and continues off of where the previous game left off. There were so many unexpected twists and turns in the plot, and that is what kept me hooked! Gameplay is the same as the original Portal, however the levels are more in depth and fun to complete.

Seriously, PLAY THIS GAME!!

Portal 2 has improved on a lot of good things from Portal. The graphics are beautiful and work on intel HD, which is a feat on it's own.

The puzzles have a variety of elements but the difficulty has not changed very much.
Everytime I got stuck at a puzzle, I took a break for about 5-10 minutes, and when I tried again, the solution became quite obvious.

The ending song was a treat. I don't know if the ending was real or not. If it was, I don't know how they would continue the story. HL + Portal collab?

Anyways, 10/10.
